instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.P5VS0_EN: What is P5VS0_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P3V3S0_EN: What is P3V3S0_EN? This signal enables the PP3V3_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P1V5S0_EN: What is P1V5S0_EN? P1V5S0_EN is an enable signal that turns on the PP1V5_S0 power rail. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message:
Hi everyone,
I am new to forum and looking forward learn. Thank you in advance .

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> when it goes sleep wont wake up

I really dont have much idea how sleep awake cycle works .

I have checked the S3 and S4 rails all of them has power while mac sleeping .

I have start to measure around enables due to  Mobile System Power State Table [FONT=Courier](Power Control 1/ENABLE)[/FONT]
But couldn't find the source of the problem .

I am looking for some wisdom to figure out the issue and understand how sleep awake cycle works .
Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message: Was this liquid damaged at some point?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message: Did you do a clean install? Have you run ASD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message: Yes I have , Each time it fails to wake when its testing bluetooth or airport sleep cycle ! Anything related sleep awake cycle .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message: When you wake it up does the fan start again? Have you disconnected everything like airport/cam/IO?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message:
When it goes sleep it doesnt wake up only way to get it start is Power button .
I have test with most basic connection  I have tested without airport camera or IO one by one even disconnected the screen test it with external Monitor .

It would be great to know Where should it first powers when you touch to keyboard or trackpad to wake it up ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message:
It's a complicated system involving software and hardware. It is not just "turning on" the power again. 
In sleep mode <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> and S5 should stay on, check that.
In most cases this is liquid damage somewhere, or the LAN chip but 3462 does not have that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with exactly the same issue, never manage to find the problem, still have the logic board somewhere, maybe I take a look tomorrow.... It is still a good ($$$) LB....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SLP_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SLP_S5</SIGNAL> all good and stable . 

On the Mobile System Power State Table
Only difference  between S3 and S0 state  is <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>  Is off in S3 state and should be on s0 state 
From there 
I have checked all S0 enable rails. When I have  clicked  to the trackpad while sleeping <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> shots out 3.3v to all enables for a milli second and goes off then on 3.3v with restarts 
( It will restart When its only on charger battery not connected but with battery connected, only way to start is power button)
<SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL> 
<SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PBUSVSENS_EN</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>TBT_S0_EN</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>P1V8S0_EN</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>P1V5S0_EN</SIGNAL>
CPUVCCIOS0_EN
<SIGNAL>PVCCSA_EN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message: This will be too hard to diagnose. You don't know if the OS that was stored in RAM was corrupted or that something in the power cycle went wrong. The only thing to check is if the system enters sleep that all S3 power stays on. After that it is just stabbing in the dark, very complex problem. Although it may be only 1 resistor or FET, this will be a nightmare to diagnose. I still say liquid damage somewhere, possible cleaned already.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sleep awake cycle failure
threads.message:
I have double checked under the microscope there is no sign of L. damage
I will measure around little bit more before I give up on this and will post the results if there is any.
Thank you.
